io

Class JGroupCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgroups.ReceiverAdapter
      • io.JGroupCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Communicator, org.jgroups.MembershipListener, org.jgroups.MessageListener, org.jgroups.Receiver

    public class JGroupCommunicator
extends org.jgroups.ReceiverAdapter
implements Communicator
    Interprocess communication implementation using the JGroups library.
    Author:
    Richard

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface io.Communicator

      • SENDER_MODE_NATIVE

        public static final short SENDER_MODE_NATIVE
        Send messages in native mode (serialised Wrapper).

      • SENDER_MODE_JSON

        public static final short SENDER_MODE_JSON
        Send messages in JSON mode (Wrapper serialised as JSON String).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • suppressIncoming

        public boolean suppressIncoming
        If true, most incoming messages will be ignored. The messageReceived() method of the listener will be called only if the listener has requested a head count of group members. Useful when the owner of this JGroupCommunicator functions exclusively as the sender.

        senderId - The transmitter id for this JGroupCommunicator.
        channel - The channel to connect to.
        listener - The listener for this JGroupCommunicator.
        suppressIncoming - If true, most incoming messages will be ignored.

      • listenForMemberInfo

        public void listenForMemberInfo(boolean value)
        Enable/disable listening for member info. Used to get a head count of of agents connected to the current channel. Listener will be notified on by a call to messageReceived(MavserMessage.MEMBER_INFO).
        Parameters:
        value - True to enable listening. False to disable.

      • getMemberStrings

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMemberStrings()

        Returns:
        A list of agents connected to the channel.

      • sendString

        public boolean sendString(java.lang.String JSONString)
        Send the given String to all everyone listening on the current channel.
        NOTE: JSONString must be a valid serialisation of a Wrapper.
        Specified by:
        sendString in interface Communicator
        Parameters:
        JSONString - The JSON String to send.
        Returns:
        True if the String was successfully sent. False otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
